content: round 9 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet single_crochet in next single_crochet around 18 single_crochet round 10 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet around 24 single_crochet round 11-16 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 24 single_crochet total of 6 rounds worked even round 17 decrease over next 2 single_crochet single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet around 18 single_crochet round 18 decrease over next 2 single_crochet single_crochet in next single_crochet around 12 single_crochet round 19 decrease around 6 single_crochet round 20 slip_stitch as needed to close remaining gap and finish off weave in end wing make 2 chain 4 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook half_double_crochet in next chain in last chain work 6 double_crochet working up the other side of the starting chain half_double_crochet in next chain single_crochet in last chain join with slip_stitch to first chain and finish off leaving a long end for sewing the wing to the body weave in other end or pull it through body as well finishing sew wings to body placing the top of the wing at the first round of the body embroider eyes and beak nests double-stranded nest for single bird with 2 strands of yarn and an i hook chain 4 join with slip_stitch to form ring round 1 6 single_crochet in ring 6 single_crochet do not join round 2 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 12 single_crochet round 3 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet single_crochet in next single_crochet around 18 single_crochet round 4-5 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 18 single_crochet at the end of round 5 slip_stitch in next 2 single_crochet finish off and weave in ends triple-stranded nest for pair of birds with 3 strands of yarn and a k hook chain 4 join with slip_stitch to form ring round 1 6 single_crochet in ring 6 single_crochet do not join round 2 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 12 single_crochet round 3 * 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet 3 times then 3 single_crochet * repeat from * to * twice 18 single_crochet round 4 * 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet single_crochet in next single_crochet 3 times then 3 single_crochet * repeat from * to * twice 24 single_crochet round 5 * 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet 3 times then 3 single_crochet * repeat from * to * twice 30 single_crochet round 6-7 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 30 single_crochet at the end of round 7 slip_stitch in next single_crochet finish off and weave in ends your little birds should fit perfectly in their nests -d little birds in their nests crochet pattern is copyright 2008 by deborah ellis please do not reproduce this pattern in whole or in part please feel free however to sell any items that you make from this pattern if you have any questions at all please contact the author at neatlytangled@gmail com thank you
